p: The two scenarios of climate change we considered both resulted in an increase in the quantity of kit fox habitat and a corresponding slight increase in fox population numbers in much of the speciesâ€™ range (see S1 Table). Both climate models predicted conversion from forest and woodland to grasslands around the perimeter of the San Joaquin Valley. The net increase in grasslands was just over 50% for each model. The CCSM model also predicts a doubling of scrub habitat (see Table 1).
